definition:
A permutation group $G$ on a set $X$ is [*Frobenius*]{} if no
non-trivial element of $G$ fixes more than one element of $X$.
Generally, one also makes the restriction that at least one non-trivial
element fix a point. In this case the Frobenius group is called
[*non-regular*]{}.

The stabilizer of any point in $X$ is called a [*Frobenius
complement*]{}, and has the remarkable property that it is distinct from
any conjugate by an element not in the subgroup. Conversely, if any
finite group $G$ has such a subgroup, then the action on cosets of that
subgroup makes $G$ into a Frobenius group.
